content.raw: I had to make one more change - get rid of std::make\_unique usages, because I figured out they’re c\+\+14 features. I’ve no idea how it could compile before, but taking into account [#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2663/build-error-gazebo9-and-dart](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2663/build-error-gazebo9-and-dart) , it is possible that before something was providing a definition for std::make\_unique and now it stopped doing so.
content.html: I had to make one more change - get rid of std::make_unique usages, because I figured out they’re c++14 features. I’ve no idea how it could compile before, but taking into account #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2663/build-error-gazebo9-and-dart , it is possible that before something was providing a definition for std::make_unique and now it stopped doing so.

content.html:
LGTM when the warning is fixed. Thanks for iterating!

Latest CI:

  • Homebrew
  • Xenial

When you tackle the deprecation warning, you could also make this change that fixes a warning on my compiler:

diff -r afa33c6e2b98 plugins/KeysToCmdVelPlugin.cc
--- a/plugins/KeysToCmdVelPlugin.cc     Fri Aug 30 16:42:13 2019 +0200
+++ b/plugins/KeysToCmdVelPlugin.cc     Fri Aug 30 11:33:44 2019 -0700
@@ -325,7 +325,7 @@
 /////////////////////////////////////////////////
 void KeysToCmdVelPlugin::OnKeyPress(ConstAnyPtr &_msg)
 {
-  const auto key = static_cast<const unsigned int>(_msg->int_value());
+  const auto key = static_cast<unsigned int>(_msg->int_value());

   double linearVel = 0., angularVel = 0.;
   bool linearVelSet = false, angularVelSet = false;

content.raw:
We need to suppress the deprecation warning when this function is used: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1738/warnings10Result/new/

You can do it by wrapping the line in

```
#ifndef _WIN32
#pragma GCC diagnostic push
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations"
#endif

// line that triggers warning

#ifndef _WIN32
  #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
#endif
```
content.html:
We need to suppress the deprecation warning when this function is used: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1738/warnings10Result/new/

You can do it by wrapping the line in

#ifndef _WIN32
#pragma GCC diagnostic push
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdeprecated-declarations"
#endif

// line that triggers warning

#ifndef _WIN32
  #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
#endif

content.raw: We usually don't deprecate functionality in the middle of a major release because users are not expecting to get warnings while still using the same major version. But since this plugin is relatively new I think we can let this one slide.
content.html: We usually don't deprecate functionality in the middle of a major release because users are not expecting to get warnings while still using the same major version. But since this plugin is relatively new I think we can let this one slide.

content.raw: Ok, so it’s time for ugly fixes… I’ll probably just make the new functions non-virtual and people with gazebo 9 will have no choice to override them… When porting to newer versions, this commit can then be reverted or not cherry-picked.
content.html: Ok, so it’s time for ugly fixes… I’ll probably just make the new functions non-virtual and people with gazebo 9 will have no choice to override them… When porting to newer versions, this commit can then be reverted or not cherry-picked.

content.html:
The ABI could be ok since the new functions are not pure virtual. The ABI checker will tell:

If it does break ABI, we'll need an ugly fix, or this should be targeted at gazebo11.

CC @Jose Luis Rivero
